definition: to such an extent as to/down to/up to
abbr. for Israel 以色列[Yi3 se4 lie4]
to use/by means of/according to/in order to/because of/at (a certain date or place)
to send/to devote/to deliver/to cause/to convey
to study sth to apply it/study for practical applications
so that/to the point that

sentences.english: But Jesus made no reply, not even to a single charge--to the great amazement of the governor.
sentences.chinese: 耶穌仍不回答，連一句話也不說，以致巡撫甚覺希奇。

sentences.english: Severe cases may progress to confusion and coma.
sentences.chinese: 情況嚴重的會進一步惡化以致昏迷及神志不清。

sentences.english: Even the sleepy Endymion was fascinated at the sight of the fair maiden as he opened his eyes.
sentences.chinese: 但眼前的一切很快消失，以致他誤認爲這是一場夢幻。

sentences.english: And he answered him to never a word; insomuch that the governor marvelled greatly.
sentences.chinese: 耶穌仍不回答，連一句話也不說，以致巡撫甚覺希奇。

sentences.english: Birds floating so close together in some places that she couldn't see the water.
sentences.chinese: 於某處遊在一起以致她看不到水面。

sentences.english: To dwell in the cliffs of the valleys, in caves of the earth, and in the rocks.
sentences.chinese: 以致他們住在荒谷之間，在地洞和巖穴中。

sentences.english: He is so strong that he can lift the stone .
sentences.chinese: 他如此的強壯，以致於可以舉起這塊石頭。

sentences.english: Slowly, the comfort create a rim of beer belly.
sentences.chinese: 以致於慢慢地養了一圈的脾酒肚。

sentences.english: So a benign cycle, makes, the scale benefits.
sentences.chinese: 以致形成良性循環，薄利多銷，向規模要效益。

sentences.english: From which I will learn often and work hard.
sentences.chinese: 我會勤以致學，工作不輟。

sentences.english: I think we're so good that we'll be asked to play in the Olympic Games.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲我們如此棒，以致於會被邀請去奧運會打比賽。

sentences.english: So many copies were sold that the factory was producing 320,000 copies of the record every day.
sentences.chinese: 唱片的銷路非常好，以致唱片廠的日產量達32萬張。

sentences.english: There are so many works of art that some of them must be stored away.
sentences.chinese: 羅浮宮的館藏衆多，以致於有些藝術品必須收存起來。

sentences.english: It was so hot a day that tey all went swimming.
sentences.chinese: 天是那麼的熱以致他們都去游泳了。

sentences.english: The situations we face are so complex that no one can guarantee no mistakes at all.
sentences.chinese: 我們面對的情況如此複雜，以致無人能始終都不出錯。

sentences.english: Some days I was too tied to get out of bed.
sentences.chinese: 有時候我太疲勞了以致於起不了牀。

definition: down to/up to/to such an extent as to .../also written 以至於|以至于[yi3 zhi4 yu2]
to cause/to result in
even/so much so that
for this reason
so much so that/to the extent that/even
not in such a way as to/not likely to
therefore
therefore
almost
moreover/in addition to that
even/so much so that
due to/as a result of/thanks to/owing to/since/because
even/going as far as to/so much so that
frequently/often
to fall into disuse (of laws, customs etc)/to neglect
to be caused by
